remarks: Sufficient condition for an element to be equal to the supremum. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2015.)
statement:
supmo.1 $e |- ( ph -> R Or A ) $.
eqsupd.2 $e |- ( ph -> C e. A ) $.
eqsupd.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ y e. B ) -> -. C R y ) $.
eqsupd.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( y e. A /\ y R C ) ) -> E. z e. B y R z ) $.
eqsupd $p |- ( ph -> sup ( B , A , R ) = C ) $.
$d A y z $.
$d B y z $.
$d C y $.
$d R y z $.
$d ph y $.
